templates.template: GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP
templates.name: GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP
templates.description:
Discover GCP Compute Engine instances by HTTP with script item usage.
This template will be automatically connected to discovered entities with all their required parameters pre-defined.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback.


Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Guest visible vCPUs
items.description:
Number of vCPUs visible inside the guest.
For many GCE machine types, the number of vCPUs visible inside the guest is equal to the `compute.googleapis.com/instance/cpu/reserved_cores` metric.
For shared-core machine types, the number of guest-visible vCPUs differs from the number of reserved cores.
For example, e2-small instances have two vCPUs visible inside the guest and 0.5 fractional vCPUs reserved.
Therefore, for an e2-small instance, `compute.googleapis.com/instance/cpu/guest_visible_vcpus` has a value of 2 and `compute.googleapis.com/instance/cpu/reserved_cores` has a value of 0.5.

items.name: Reserved vCPUs
items.description: Number of vCPUs reserved on the host of the instance.

items.name: Scheduler wait time
items.description:
Wait time is the time a vCPU is ready to run, but unexpectedly not scheduled to run.
The wait time returned here is the accumulated value for all vCPUs.
The time interval for which the value was measured is returned by Monitoring in whole seconds as start_time and end_time.
This metric is only available for VMs that belong to the e2 family or to overcommitted VMs on sole-tenant nodes.

items.name: CPU usage time
items.description:
Delta vCPU usage for all vCPUs, in vCPU-seconds.
To compute the per-vCPU utilization fraction, divide this value by (end-start)*N, where end and start define this value's time interval and N is `compute.googleapis.com/instance/cpu/reserved_cores` at the end of the interval.
This value is reported by the hypervisor for the VM and can differ from `agent.googleapis.com/cpu/usage_time`, which is reported from inside the VM.

items.name: CPU utilization
items.description:
Fractional utilization of allocated CPU on this instance.
This metric is reported by the hypervisor for the VM and can differ from `agent.googleapis.com/cpu/utilization`, which is reported from inside the VM.

triggers.expression: min(/GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP/gcp.gce.cpu.utilization,15m) >= {$GCE.CPU.UTIL.MAX}
triggers.name: High CPU utilization
triggers.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

items.name: Disks get
items.description: Disk entities and metrics related to a particular instance.

items.name: Firewall: Dropped bytes
items.description: Count of incoming bytes dropped by the firewall.

items.name: Firewall: Dropped packets
items.description: Count of incoming packets dropped by the firewall.

items.name: Instance state
items.description: GCP Compute Engine instance state.

triggers.expression: last(/GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP/gcp.gce.instance.state) = 10
triggers.name: Failed to get the instance state
triggers.description:
Failed to get the instance state.
Check access permissions to GCP API or service account.

triggers.expression: last(/GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP/gcp.gce.instance.state) = 7
triggers.name: Instance is in suspended state
triggers.description: The VM is in a suspended state. You can resume the VM or delete it.

triggers.expression: last(/GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP/gcp.gce.instance.state) = 4
triggers.name: The instance is in repairing state
triggers.description:
The VM is being repaired.
Repairing occurs when the VM encounters an internal error or the underlying machine is unavailable due to maintenance.
During this time, the VM is unusable.

triggers.expression: last(/GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP/gcp.gce.instance.state) = 5
triggers.name: The instance is in terminated state
triggers.description: The VM is stopped. You stopped the VM, or the VM encountered a failure.

items.name: Instance uptime
items.description: Elapsed time since the VM was started, in seconds.

items.name: Integrity: Early boot validation status
items.description:
The validation status of early boot integrity policy.
Empty value if integrity monitoring isn't enabled.

items.name: Integrity: Late boot validation status
items.description:
The validation status of late boot integrity policy.
Empty value if integrity monitoring isn't enabled.

items.name: Memory usage percentage
items.description:
Memory usage Percentage.
This metric is only available for VMs that belong to the e2 family; returns empty value for different instance types.

triggers.expression: min(/GCP Compute Engine Instance by HTTP/gcp.gce.memory.ram_pused,15m) >= {$GCE.RAM.UTIL.MAX}
triggers.name: High memory utilization
triggers.description: RAM utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

items.name: Memory size
items.description:
Total VM memory size.
This metric is only available for VMs that belong to the e2 family; returns empty value for different instance types.

items.name: Memory used
items.description:
Memory currently used in the VM.
This metric is only available for VMs that belong to the e2 family; returns empty value for different instance types.

items.name: VM swap in
items.description:
The amount of memory read into the guest from its own swap space.
This metric is only available for VMs that belong to the e2 family; returns empty value for different instance types.

items.name: VM swap out
items.description:
The amount of memory written from the guest to its own swap space.
This metric is only available for VMs that belong to the e2 family; returns empty value for different instance types.

items.name: Metrics get
items.description: GCP Compute Engine metrics get in raw format.

items.name: Network: Received bytes
items.description: Count of bytes received from the network without load-balancing.

items.name: Network: Received bytes: Load-balanced
items.description:
Whether traffic was received by an L3 loadbalanced IP address assigned to the VM.
Traffic that is externally routed to the VM's standard internal or external IP address, such as L7 loadbalanced traffic, is not considered to be loadbalanced in this metric.
The value is empty when load-balancing is not used.

items.name: Network: Received packets
items.description: Count of packets received from the network without load-balancing.

items.name: Network: Received packets: Load-balanced
items.description:
Whether traffic was received by an L3 loadbalanced IP address assigned to the VM.
Traffic that is externally routed to the VM's standard internal or external IP address, such as L7 loadbalanced traffic, is not considered to be loadbalanced in this metric.
The value is empty when load-balancing is not used.

items.name: Network: Sent bytes
items.description: Count of bytes sent over the network without load-balancing.

items.name: Network: Sent bytes: Load-balanced
items.description:
Whether traffic was received by an L3 loadbalanced IP address assigned to the VM.
Traffic that is externally routed to the VM's standard internal or external IP address, such as L7 loadbalanced traffic, is not considered to be loadbalanced in this metric.
The value is empty when load-balancing is not used.

items.name: Network: Sent packets
items.description: Count of packets sent over the network without load-balancing.

items.name: Network: Sent packets: Load-balanced
items.description:
Whether traffic was received by an L3 loadbalanced IP address assigned to the VM.
Traffic that is externally routed to the VM's standard internal or external IP address, such as L7 loadbalanced traffic, is not considered to be loadbalanced in this metric.
The value is empty when load-balancing is not used.

items.name: Network: Mirrored bytes
items.description: The count of mirrored bytes.

items.name: Network: Mirrored packets
items.description: The count of mirrored packets.

items.name: Network: Mirrored packets dropped: Invalid
items.description:
The count of mirrored packets dropped.
Reason - invalid.

items.name: Network: Mirrored packets dropped: Out of quota
items.description:
The count of mirrored packets dropped.
Reason - out of quota.

items.name: Network: Mirrored packets dropped: Unknown
items.description:
The count of mirrored packets dropped.
Reason - unknown.
